title: Distance Formula Explorer
creator: AI-Generated MicroSim
subject: Mathematics
Geometry
Coordinate Geometry
Algebra
description: An interactive educational simulation that helps students visualize and apply the distance formula to find distances between two points on the coordinate plane, demonstrating the connection to the Pythagorean theorem through visual right triangles.

learningObjectives: Apply the distance formula to find distances between two points on a coordinate plane
Understand the connection between the distance formula and the Pythagorean theorem
Visualize the geometric relationship between horizontal distance, vertical distance, and diagonal distance
Calculate distances using both algebraic formulas and visual representations
Analyze how changing point positions affects distance and triangle dimensions
prerequisites: Familiarity with coordinate plane and plotting points

controls.name: Point A
controls.description: Blue draggable point representing the first coordinate (x₁, y₁)

controls.name: Point B
controls.description: Red draggable point representing the second coordinate (x₂, y₂)

controls.name: Show Right Triangle
controls.description: Toggles visibility of the right triangle formed by horizontal and vertical legs

controls.name: Show Calculation Steps
controls.description: Displays step-by-step calculation of the distance formula

controls.name: Snap to Grid
controls.description: Constrains dragged points to integer coordinates

controls.name: Random Points
controls.description: Generates random coordinates for both points within the grid range

controls.name: Point A Coordinates
controls.description: Manual entry fields for x₁ and y₁ coordinates

controls.name: Point B Coordinates
controls.description: Manual entry fields for x₂ and y₂ coordinates

visualElements: Coordinate grid with labeled axes (-10 to +10)
Two draggable colored points (blue for A, red for B)
Purple line showing distance between points
Optional gray right triangle with labeled legs
Real-time coordinate display for both points

assumptions: Grid range limited to -10 to +10 for clarity
limitations: Does not extend to 3D coordinate systems
Limited to Cartesian coordinates (no polar coordinates)
Grid resolution fixed at integer precision when snapping enabled

assessmentOpportunities: Identify point pairs that create specific distances
Explain the relationship to Pythagorean theorem
differentiation: Snap to grid for beginners working with integers
Free positioning for advanced students working with decimals
Calculation steps toggle supports multiple learning paces
Random points provide unlimited practice opportunities
commonMisconceptions: Forgetting to square the differences before adding
Sign errors when working with negative coordinates
Confusing distance formula with slope formula
Not taking the square root of the sum
